        public static javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loadView​(javafx.stage.Stage stage,
                                              java.lang.String view)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a new View onto a Stage. This updates the stage to a new View with some size bounding.
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage to update.
        view - Path to the FXML document for the new View.
        Returns:
        an instance of the FXMLLoader to interact with, if necessary.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - さあ

      • displayAlert

        public static java.util.Optional<javafx.scene.control.ButtonType> displayAlert​(javafx.scene.control.Alert alert)
        Wrapper around Alert.showAndWait() to fix sizing issues. On my Linux system alert dialogs do not show properly via normal usage, so this provides a quick fix. See https://github.com/javafxports/openjdk-jfx/issues/222 and https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8246795

        This function makes use of a lambda expression to execute a couple of statements inside of a separate thread from the JavaFX application's thread so that time is given for the alert window to resize itself before making the window not resizeable via mouse. This is needed to get around buggy behaviour in JavaFX under tiling WMs.

        Parameters:
        alert - The instantiated Alert object to apply changes on.
        Returns:
        a result object containing information about the user's actions.

      • detailedAlert

        public static javafx.scene.control.Alert detailedAlert​(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type,
                                                       java.lang.String message,
                                                       java.lang.String details)
        Wrapper function to create a detailed Alert. This prepares a label and expanded textarea in a typical alert dialog.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of alert, e.g. confirmation or error.
        message - The headlining message of the alert prompt.
        details - Specific details associated with the alert that are relevant to the user.
        Returns:
        an instance of the Alert object to act upon.

      • getStage

        public static javafx.stage.Stage getStage​(javafx.event.Event event)
        This takes an FX event and identifies the Stage that it came from. https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/javafx/api/javafx/event/Event.html
        Parameters:
        event - an FX event triggered from the application.
        Returns:
        the Stage the event occurred in.
